variant.question: Which of the following statements describes normal conditions?

options.text: Temperature decreases with height in the troposphere.
Temperature increases with height in the troposphere.
Temperature decreases at a similar rate in the troposphere as in the stratosphere.
Temperature decreases with height in the stratosphere.

variant.question: The heat energy used to change water vapour into liquid water

options.text: Modifies the DALR to the SALR.
Is then stored in the water vapour as latent heat.
Is released to the atmosphere as latent heat.
Is passed to the surface from which the water is evaporating.

variant.question: What happens in evaporation

options.text: The water molecules turn to solid

variant.question: Which of the following statements is untrue?

options.text: The Coriolis force deflects the wind to the right in both hemispheres.
The magnitude of geostrophic wind deflects the wind to the left in the Southern Hemisphere.
The magnitude of geostrophic wind is similar to the Coriolis force.
The Coriolis force deflects the wind to the right in the Northern Hemisphere only.

variant.question: As regards to water, which state change process delivers the main part of energy in thunderstorms and hurricanes?
A super-cooled droplet is one that:

options.text: Remains liquid at a below freezing temperature
Has frozen to become an ice pellet
Has a shell of ice with water inside it

Is at an above freezing temperature in below freezing
air

variant.question: When water vapour condenses or water freezes:

options.text: heat is released in both cases.
heat is released and heat is required respectively.
heat is required and heat is released respectively.
heat is required in both cases.

variant.question: A super cooled droplet is

options.text: a droplet still in liquid state at a temperature below freezing.
a small particle of water at a temperature below -50 Â°C.
a water droplet that has been frozen during its descent.
a water droplet that is mainly frozen.

variant.question: In which of the following changes of state is latent heat released?

In which of the following changes of state is latent heat released?

What is condensation?

options.text: The change of state from water vapor to liquid water.
The change of state from ice to water vapor or from water vapor to ice.
The change of state from liquid water to water vapor.
The change of state from ice to liquid water.

variant.question: Which of the following changes of state is known as sublimation (in meteorology)?
Which of the following changes of state is known as evaporation?
Which of the following changes of state is known as evaporation?
Which of the following changes of state is known as condensation?
Which of the following changes of state is known as condensation?
Which of the following changes of state is known as sublimation?
When water vapor condenses into water droplets:

options.text: heat energy is released that makes the surrounding air warmer.
heat energy is absorbed that decreases density of the surrounding air.
heat energy is released that increases density of the surrounding air.
heat energy is absorbed that makes the surrounding air colder.

variant.question: The heat energy released to change water vapour into liquid water:

options.text: modifies the lapse rate of the air parcel - that moves vertically - from the DALR to the SALR.
is then stored in the water vapour as latent heat.
will never modify the lapse rate.
is passed to the surface from which the water is evaporating.

variant.question: Within the atmosphere water exists in different states. Which change of state process delivers the main part of the energy in thunderstorms and hurricanes?
In the atmosphere, what contributes to initiate the condensation process?
Which of the following changes of state is known as freezing?
Which of the following changes of state is known as freezing?
Which of the following changes of state is known as melting?
Which of the following changes of state is known as melting?
Which statement is true for condensation?

options.text: Latent heat is released to the atmosphere.
Latent heat is absorbed from the surrounding air by the water droplet.
Latent heat is transformed into pure energy.

variant.question: When the temperature is at (1) ___ and the water vapor change from (2) ___ the process is called (3) ___.

options.text: (1) 0 Â°C or below; (2) ice to gas; (3) sublimation
(1) 0 Â°C or below; (2) water to ice; (3) deposition
(1) 10 Â°C or below; (2) water to gas; (3) fusion
(1) 10 Â°C or below; (2) ice to water; (3) sublimation

variant.question: When considering water changing state by melting from a solid to liquid form and evaporating from liquid form to a gas which of the following statements is true:

options.text: There is no change in heat energy.
The temperature increses by 5 degrees for every 1litre of water.

What, among others, will probably occur when cold, moist air covers a warm surface?

options.text: The stability of the air near the surface will increase.

variant.question: The changes of state of water are referred to as...

options.text: melting, freezing, sublimation, deposition, vaporisation, condensation
liquidation, freezing, evaporation, sublimation, melting, ratiation
vaporisation, freezing, sublimation, contamination, melting, deposition
freezing, liquidation, vaporisation, sublimation, condensation, splitting

variant.question: If air is cooled to its dew point condensation occurs. If the temperature is further reduced:

options.text: The wet bulb temperature remains fixed.

variant.question:
Read this description
 'After such a fine day, the ring around the moon was a bad sign yesterday evening for the weather today And, sure enough, it is pouring down outside
 The clouds are making an oppressively low ceiling of uniform grey but at least it has become a little bit warmer.' 

Which of these weather phenomena is being described?

options.text: Weather at the back of a cold front
